location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

mods.abstract: An aerial photograph taken during a flight by the Royal Air Force from Gilgit to Risalpur on 8 November 1934 at 10:49 at approximately 8500 feet. This photograph shows a view of Chamngarh nala with three RAF Hawker Hart aircraft visible in the bottom centre of the print; the tip of one of the imaging aircraft's wings is visible in the foreground.The photograph was taken by a technical camera; the following gauges are visible on the photographic print: an altitude meter indicating the height of the aircraft, spirit levels showing the pitch of the aircraft, a counter indicating the number of exposures, and a watch indicating the time the photograph was shot.On the reverse of the print is a stamp reading ‘ROYAL AIR FORCE CROWN COPYRIGHT RESERVED’, No. 2 Indian Wing Station, dated 22 February 1935.See folios 131-141 for particulars on the flight in question.
